metadata.subject: An Iconic Offering - A 38.5 Acre Development Site on the Las Vegas Strip
metadata.sender: Cushman & Wakefield, Commerce Real Estate Solutions

organizations: Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority

relationships.description: Exclusive real estate advisor for property sale

relationships.entity_2: MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, Luxor
relationships.description: Adjacent to four of the largest resorts in North America
Direct access to private jet terminals for high rollers

transactions: Existing income of approximately $275,000 annually from current tenants
assets: Office building at 3951 Las Vegas Blvd
Commercial building at 3953 Las Vegas Blvd

analysis.purpose: To market and sell a 38.5-acre development site on the Las Vegas Strip to potential investors
analysis.significance: Major development opportunity in prime Las Vegas location with potential for 10,000-room resort casino

concerns: Zoning and FAA approval processes outlined

notable_quotes: Situated directly across from the Mandalay Bay Resort, an investor could obtain permits within approximately nine months to develop a visionary themed large-scale resort and gaming destination with up to 10,000 hotel rooms.

Las Vegas gaming revenues, levels of new development, visitor volumes and visitor spending are all approaching record levels making the timing associated with the development of the Site extremely compelling.
The Site is visible to over 42 million visitors per year traveling through McCarran International Airport.
red_flags: Previous Skyvue development was halted in 2012 with incomplete construction
Environmental assessment required due to potential hazardous materials

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this real estate offering document

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is a standard real estate offering memorandum

public_knowledge.context: Large-scale Las Vegas real estate developments typically receive significant media coverage

analysis.summary: This is a real estate offering memorandum for a 38.5-acre development site on the Las Vegas Strip, marketed by Cushman & Wakefield as a prime location for a large-scale resort casino with up to 10,000 hotel rooms. The document highlights the site's strategic location, existing income streams, and the strong Las Vegas tourism market to attract potential investors.
